title: Job Openings at DP World
content:
DP World - We exist to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally. With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 108,100 employees spanning 74 countries on six continents. We are pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future. We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Technical Superintendent

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	Responsible for the overall management and technical operations of the vessels under his responsibility. This includes overseeing the daily maintenance and repair, budgeting, survey scheduling, onboard general assessment of vessels, inspections and docking when required.
	Ensure Company owned and managed vessels are operated in a safe, efficient and economical manner and in full compliance with Class and Statutory regulations.
	Ensure the assigned vessels are fully operational technically or otherwise managed accordingly to the management agreement requirements.
	To maintain the classification status of the vessels under his charge and to ensure that the survey status reports are sent to the vessels on a monthly basis.
	Support and monitor on-board Planned Preventive Maintenance to ensure cost effective management and effective implementation of this function.
	Ensure that Vessels Planned maintenance system is being operated and reported in the manner prescribed in the company’s standards and procedures.
	Budget responsibility for technical elements of the assigned vessels.
	Responsible for overseeing the installation and certification of 3rd party equipment on the vessels, such as Diving, ROV and other temporary equipment.
	Liaise with Vessel Masters and Chief Engineers as required and providing technical advice and assistance when necessary.
	Identify and source for technical and operational supplies required for the vessels and ensure that the rates are most economical.
	Co-ordinate and supervise service repairs, utilizing approved sub-contractors as required and ensure all such repairs are completed in a timely and satisfactory manner and within the vessel’s set operational budget.
	Prepare accurate and comprehensive vessel dry-dock specifications and to supervise dry-dockings and repairs to completion as directed. Dry dockings and repairs may take place at a location remote from normal place of work.
	Liaising with repair yard management, sub-contractors, Class and Administration to ensure all works are carried out in accordance with agreed specifications and time schedules.
	Providing written reports as required, detailing in service repairs dry-docking repairs and surveys, including costs incurred during such activities.
	Ensure all relevant information regarding a vessel repair / docking is updated in the PMS system.
	Liaise with customers on technical and operational matters including vessel performance.
	Liaise with the Purchasing department to ensure that purchase requisitions are being tracked and expedited in a timely manner. Report to Fleet Manager when delays have the potential to impact on vessels operational capabilities. Ensure minimum spare requirements are met.
	Perform monthly review of logs processes and attend to vessel inspections and submit reports.
	Responsible for the control and updating of the vessel Technical Library (ship’s plans and drawings) as required.
	Ensure IMCA guidelines and “best industry practices” are adhered to at all times.
	Oversee and give input to prepare tender documents including establishing costs/budgets/programs and be part of subsequent bid/tender evaluations.
	Contribute to the appraisal and selection of repair yards and technical service providers.
	Carry out appraisals of Chief Engineers on board his vessel at end of their contract.


Other:


	Maintain high technical knowledge and ensure personal development through training and self-development.
	Undertake any other Technical related assignments as and when required.
	Participate in annual review and evaluate projects to determine success and how improvements can be made in the future report and present findings.


Minimum Qualifications


	Unlimited STCW ’95 Chief Engineer’s license (Motor) sea going vessels or
	Engineering degree/diploma in mechanics/electromechanical engineering.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Medical Representative

Job Location: Lagos

Job Function


	To drive consistent sales growth and achievement of sales goals and targets in the country and in assigned key accounts by identifying opportunities and gaining new business while growing the existing business for Bayer Pharma and Bayer Consumer Health portfolio.


Key Performance Areas


	Passion for Performance: Deliver strong sales and market share growth in the assigned territory.
	Deliver Growth: Achievement of sales, market share and growth objectives for the country through effective execution of agreed strategies and annual strategic brand plans.
	Excellence in Execution: Achieve effective and efficient territory coverage by delivering agreed pharmacy and HCP call rates aligned to the customer segmentation and targeting plan.
	Key Opinion Leaders and Stakeholder relationship management: Develop collaborative external and internal relationships that enhance customer care journey and channel feedback.
	Collaboration: Develop collaborative external and internal relationships that enhance customer journeys, channel customer feedback into the organization.
	Embrace a performance driven and results-focused working culture that delivers on sales commitments.
	Expense budget management, financial control and procedures.
	Other duties as required by the KAM/BUH.


Qualifications Required


	Candidates should possess a Tertiary qualification in Life Sciences, Sales, Marketing or Business.


Experience and Skills Required:


	Minimum of 3 years of sales experience in Pharmaceutical Industry.
	Prior experience in market pharmacy & hospital environment is an advantage and preferred.
	Strong sales track record and evidence of delivering on targets consistently
	Advanced proficiency in MS Office Suite
	Exceptional presentation and communication skills
	Excellent planning, organizational and problem-solving skills
	Ability to engage, collaborate and influence at all organizational and management levels.
	Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Manager, SHERQ

Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos

Job Function


	As the dedicated QHSE Manager, your role is to lead and execute holistic Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment (QHSE) strategies for transportation and warehouse operations.
	You are entrusted with ensuring strict adherence to industry standards, thereby safeguarding the well-being of employees, protecting goods, and preserving the environment.
	Your responsibilities include overseeing regulatory compliance, formulating and implementing risk mitigation protocols, and spearheading continuous improvement initiatives.
	By cultivating a safe working environment, minimizing hazards, and optimizing processes in both the transport and warehouse sectors, you contribute to the overall efficiency, resilience, and excellence of our operations.


Key Performance Areas
HSEQ Standards & Compliance:


	Formulate and execute pertinent health, safety, and environmental standards alongside the implementation of quality management system procedures, work instructions, and other essential quality system requisites.
	Offer expertise and insight to supervise the evolution, execution, and ongoing enhancement of QHSE (Quality, Health, Safety, and Environment) strategies, standards, and programs.
	Guarantee the presence of necessary programs and protective measures to curtail employee and corporate QHSE risks, thereby minimizing potential adverse effects.
	Continuously monitor, assess, and suggest enhancements to the QHSE systems in place.
	Disseminate clear and comprehensive communications regarding QHSE requisites and expectations, fostering uniformity across all MDS sites.
	Formulate, supervise, and execute QHSE audit programs (inclusive of certifications) and tools, ensuring consistent adherence to relevant QHSE standards throughout the organization.
	Offer assistance and information to the head of QHSE MS (Management System) and other stakeholders concerning all QHSE-related matters, facilitating the continual enhancement of the QHSE Management System.


HSEQ Safe Work Systems (QHSE Risks) Management):


	Keep an updated QHSE Hazard Register and ensure the formulation and documentation of corrective action plans.
	Coordinate accident and incident reporting, investigations, and documentation, overseeing corrective action tracking via MDS's Incident Reporting System.
	Aid project management in coordinating Management of Change, Process Hazard Analysis (PHA), or Job Hazard Analysis (JHA) to bolster the QHSE management system in alignment with plant projects.
	Possess the capability to secure, sustain, and renew, when necessary, local, state, and federal permits or plans essential for the continuous safe operation of our business.
	Identify and propose resources, equipment, procedural adjustments, and process alterations to manage or eradicate workplace hazards while minimizing environmental impacts.
	Offer leadership and guidance in establishing effective methodologies to mitigate workplace risks, supervising the development and execution of safer alternatives and emergency management protocols.
	Spearhead the management and progression of risk assessment and monitoring efforts.
	Conduct assessments and audits to identify disparities in site compliance with group standards.
	Devise and maintain strategies and programs ensuring compliance with all pertinent HSE legislation and regulations.
	Cultivate and retain specialized knowledge regarding both evolving and existing Health, Safety, and Environment regulations and directives, offering guidance on anticipated future requirements.


Audits & Management Review:


	Establish a database tracking system designed to oversee the execution of corrective measures, encompassing audits, HSE cases, incidents, drills, potential incidents, and HSE meetings.
	Ensure timely execution of audit plans, both internal and external, with the closure of corrective action plans (RAPs) from external audits within stipulated timelines.


Qualifications Required


	Bachelor’s degree from a recognized institution or a relevant postgraduate business qualification (MBA or equivalent tertiary qualification).
	NEBOSH - IGC.
	ISO 45001 Lead Auditor Certificate
	ISO 14001 Lead Auditor Certificate
	ISO 9001:2015 Lead Auditor Certificate.


Experience and Skills Required:


	Minimum of 6-8 years of QHSE experience.
	Transport and Logistics experience.
	Warehouse experience.
	Freight Forwarding experience.
	Manufacturing experience.

title: Job Vacancies at SortOut Consult
content:
SortOut Consult is a forward-thinking consulting agency dedicated to helping organizations grow through strategic recruitment, tailored training solutions, and innovative organizational development initiatives. We partner with businesses to build capable teams, enhance performance, and create sustainable structures that drive long-term success.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales and Marketing Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a full-time on-site role for a Sales and Marketing Executive, located in Lagos State, Nigeri
	The role involves developing and executing sales strategies, providing exceptional customer service, managing sales process.
	The Sales and Marketing Executive will also be responsible for growing market presence, building and maintaining client relationships, and identifying new business opportunities.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor`s Degree
	1-2 years of experience in the oil and gas industry is advantageous
	Strong Communication and Customer Service skills to effectively interact with clients and team members.
	Proficient understanding and experience in Sales Management.
	Proven ability to develop and manage client relationships, with a focus on delivering value and achieving targets.
	Strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities to identify and exploit business opportunities.
	Strong knowledge of market trends and ability to adapt to a dynamic business environment..
	Proficient in Excel to Prepare quotations.
	Work with the operations team to ensure timely product delivery.
	Keep accurate records of all sales activities.
	Meet assigned monthly and quarterly sales targets..
	Ability to work under pressure and meet targets.
	Customer service oriented.


Salary
N150,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 24th December, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their applications to: sortoutconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Candidates located in or near Lekki will be given priority.

 

 

2.) Business Development / Marketing Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Job Function


	Responsible for various marketing initiatives and drive, identifying new markets/customers, formulating innovative ideas, including best mix of social media/print media tools, engaging potential customers on the product line, must be trainable, responsible for increasing sales through direct his/her direct marketing efforts.
	Must be self-driven to achieve goals with minimal supervision. You would also be responsible for other marketing staff within the Company and creating an ideal marketing structure for effective execution of the long term goals of the Company.


Other functions include:


	Preparing and delivering marketing plans within key objectives as stipulated by management team
	Working with in-house/external designers to produce materials of visual impact and within brand guidelines
	Involving key stakeholders for product at each stage of campaign, and reporting results once completed
	Generating and executing marketing campaigns across social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and others
	Generating reports for digital marketing campaigns using data based analytics tools and also presenting this data in an easy to understand format
	Sourcing advertising opportunities and placing adverts in the press, radio or TV as appropriate to the product or service
	Liaising with media, printers and publishers as required and managing the production of marketing materials such as leaflets, flyers, posters and newsletters, including e-newsletters
	Liaising with events coordinators to maximise visibility at conferences, receptions and exhibitions, including compiling product and literature lists to display or demonstrate
	Attending key conferences to manage booth, do customer interviews and focus groups
	Monitoring competitor activity and generating leads for products and services.
	Ensuring that all stock/sales in the show room are accounted for
	Ensuring that old customers are kept and new customers found which will be monitored by continuous improvement in sales monthly
	Ensuring that the show room/ office is well stocked with all stock available in the warehouse
	Identify new business and ventures that the company should go into.
	Ensuring that proper and honest recording of resumption and closing time are kept in a ledger.
	Basic Administration duties i.e attending strategy sessions and documenting minutes of meetings.
	Proper filing of Company records, i.e, VAT receipts, and other relevant reports.
	Any other duty as may be directed by the management.


Renumeration


	Salary: N350,000 - N400,000 Monthly depending on experience
	Expenses – All expenses incurred as a direct result of marketing efforts should be properly documented and will be retired weekly
	Commissions – Sales directly attributable to marketing effort will be rewarded with 0.5% commission on Total Contract receipt, to be paid quarterly.


Application Closing Date: 28th November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: sortoutconsult@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Target Market: New Developments/Estates, Property Developers, Banks, High Net worth Individuals, and other middle or high-income individuals. A monthly target of a minimum of 20 new leads and a quarterly target of a hundred million Naira in sales.

 

 

3.) Head Chef

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Head Chef oversees all kitchen operations, ensuring high-quality food preparation, presentation, and service
	The role involves menu creation, cost control, staff supervision, and maintaining hygiene and safety standards to deliver an exceptional dining experience.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, develop, and execute creative menus in line with the restaurant’s concept and customer preferences.
	Supervise and coordinate all kitchen staff, ensuring efficiency and teamwork.
	Monitor food quality, taste, and presentation at all times.
	Manage food costs, inventory, and waste to maximize profitability.
	Ensure compliance with health, hygiene, and safety standards.
	Train, mentor, and evaluate kitchen staff performance.
	Liaise with suppliers to source high-quality ingredients at competitive prices.
	Oversee portion control, stock rotation, and kitchen cleanliness.
	Collaborate with management to plan special events, promotions, and seasonal menus.
	Handle customer feedback relating to food quality or kitchen service.


Requirements & Skills


	Diploma or certification in Culinary Arts or a related field is an advantage.
	Proven experience as a Head Chef or Senior Chef in a reputable restaurant.
	Strong leadership, communication, and organizational skills.
	In-depth knowledge of food preparation, kitchen management, and safety regulations.
	Creativity and passion for culinary excellence.
	Ability to work under pressure and maintain consistency.


Application Closing Date: 28th November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to: sortoutconsult@gmailcom using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;DevOps Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	In this role, you&rsquo;ll be our go-to expert for infrastructure, automation, and cloud, from designing resilient systems to implementing efficient CI/CD workflows and building a proactive, scalable monitoring setup.
	If you&rsquo;re hands-on with technologies like Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, Ansible, Terraform, Prometheus, Kibana and Grafana and passionate about leading a team of skilled engineers, we&rsquo;d love to talk.


Responsibilities


	Develop and Drive Our DevOps Vision: Set the direction for our DevOps strategy, building world-class infrastructure, automation, and operational processes from the ground up.
	Manage and Scale Our Cloud Environments: Architect, deploy, and support infrastructure across AWS and Azure, focusing on high availability, disaster recovery, and cost efficiency.
	Run Kubernetes Clusters: Take charge of our Kubernetes clusters for production and dev environments, ensuring security, optimal resource usage, and scaling as we grow.
	Automate and Streamline CI/CD: Build out and enhance our CI/CD pipelines using tools like Bitbucket, ArgoCD, and other industry-standard tech, making deployments smooth, fast, and safe.
	Set Up Monitoring and Logging: Design and manage robust monitoring, logging, and alerting systems with Prometheus, Grafana, and the ELK stack to keep our infrastructure healthy and issues visible.
	Write Automation Scripts: Automate everything possible, using Bash, Python, or whatever works best to save time and reduce errors.
	Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with development, QA, security, and more to integrate DevOps practices, ensuring seamless application delivery and high uptime.
	Lead and Mentor: Guide and grow our DevOps team, sharing best practices, providing support, and fostering a culture of continuous improvement.
	Focus on Security: Implement security best practices and ensure our DevOps activities meet the necessary compliance and governance standards.


Requirements
Required Experience:


	Cloud Expertise: Deep, hands-on experience with AWS and Azure, and comfortable managing everything.
	Kubernetes Knowledge: You know Kubernetes inside-out and have used it in production environments.

	Monitoring Tools: Proficient in Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK stack, with an eye for optimizing system monitoring, logging, and visualization.
	Scripting Skills: Strong experience with scripting languages like Bash and Python to automate tasks and streamline processes.
	Leadership and Mentorship: Proven ability to lead a team, provide technical guidance, and cultivate a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
	Security Savvy: Knowledge of DevOps security best practices and familiarity with industry standards.


Additional Skills:


	Multi-cloud Expertise: Experience with hybrid or multi-cloud environments.
	Cost Optimization: You know how to keep cloud costs down and optimize resources.
	Clear Communicator: You can explain complex ideas to both technical and non-technical teams with ease.

We started operations in 2002 as a transaction switching and electronic payments processing, and have progressively evolved into an integrated payment services company, building and managing payment infrastructure as well as delivering innovative payment products and transactional services throughout the African continent. At Interswitch, we offer unique career opportunities for individuals capable of playing key roles and adding value in an innovative and fun environment.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: DevOps Engineer

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary


	In this role, you’ll be our go-to expert for infrastructure, automation, and cloud, from designing resilient systems to implementing efficient CI/CD workflows and building a proactive, scalable monitoring setup.
	If you’re hands-on with technologies like Kubernetes, AWS, Azure, Ansible, Terraform, Prometheus, Kibana and Grafana and passionate about leading a team of skilled engineers, we’d love to talk.


Responsibilities


	Develop and Drive Our DevOps Vision: Set the direction for our DevOps strategy, building world-class infrastructure, automation, and operational processes from the ground up.
	Manage and Scale Our Cloud Environments: Architect, deploy, and support infrastructure across AWS and Azure, focusing on high availability, disaster recovery, and cost efficiency.
	Run Kubernetes Clusters: Take charge of our Kubernetes clusters for production and dev environments, ensuring security, optimal resource usage, and scaling as we grow.
	Automate and Streamline CI/CD: Build out and enhance our CI/CD pipelines using tools like Bitbucket, ArgoCD, and other industry-standard tech, making deployments smooth, fast, and safe.
	Set Up Monitoring and Logging: Design and manage robust monitoring, logging, and alerting systems with Prometheus, Grafana, and the ELK stack to keep our infrastructure healthy and issues visible.

	Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with development, QA, security, and more to integrate DevOps practices, ensuring seamless application delivery and high uptime.

title: Job Openings at AP3 Capital
content:
AP3 Capital is a specialist professional services and portfolio management firm that delivers a range of Business Assurance Services, Transaction Advisory Services, Policy & Research, and Investment Portfolio Management services. 

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Senior Project and Research Analyst

Job Location: Abuja
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We take a client-centred approach to the delivery of professional services to public and private sector clients and development finance institutions.
	Following a period of dynamic change and growth, we are looking for an experienced Senior Project Research Analyst who would double as team lead to support our commitment to building on recent successes, by shaping and optimising our operational strategy and delivery processes to enable us to continue to compete and win against leading firms in the sectors and markets we are active in.
	This is a unique and exciting opportunity for a globally minded individual who is committed to developing a senior-level career in the professional services industry, with entrepreneurial, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
	The ideal candidate will be proactive, detail-oriented, and possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
	She / he will have a winning mindset that will enable him or her to contribute to the development of the firm, build a client-centric orientation across our multi-disciplinary teams while providing best-in-class guidance to AP3 teams and our portfolio companies.
	This position has the potential to grow within the firm or an equivalent role in one of our portfolio companies.


Key Responsibilities


	Your duties, responsibilities and deliverables for this role are as follows:


General Responsibilities:


	The Senior Research Analyst will be responsible for the following:


Project and Research Analysis:


	Assist with screening and selection of project pipelines across diverse sectors, conducting due diligence and facilitating investor engagement.
	Provide technical assistance for the drafting of compliant bid project proposals (EOIs & RFPs) in collaboration with multidisciplinary experts.
	Conduct research, analyse data, and develop comprehensive reports on market trends, value chains, and project feasibility (including economic & financial viability).
	Collaborate with technical teams to develop project concept notes, project delivery pathways, and infrastructure assessments.
	Support the organisation and production of reports and workshops related to climate finance and infrastructure development.
	Supporting efforts to build consensus around the development of an accelerated project delivery framework, including stakeholder mapping and management to anticipate and address issues (and, where necessary, escalate such issues).
	Producing inception reports with a detailed understanding of scope, work plan –interdependencies, risks, and timelines for completion of the project assignments (incl. proposed schedule of consultations with government stakeholders and lenders)
	Contributing as required to the preparation of tender documents, coordination of the bid evaluation processes, and capturing lessons learned and ensuring the effectiveness of clients’ capacity building processes and approach.
	Supporting the PPP/Project Transactions Team in drafting and preparing progress reports.
	Participate in field surveys and data collection activities for project assessments.
	Manage project timelines, budgets, and deliverables effectively.
	Collaborate effectively with a team of analysts, consultants, and project managers.
	Maintain a strong understanding of current developments in infrastructure, climate finance, and relevant sectors in Africa.
	Supporting the PPP/Infrastructure Finance team with any additional work required.


Business Development:


	Assess, originate, and resource opportunities that fit with the company’s existing and emerging capabilities,, drawing on the competencies of its expert network.
	Build and maintain relationships with existing and potential clients, associates and partner organisations, financial institutions and multilateral partners, and government officials.
	Coordinate with development partners and private sector financiers to ensure opportunities to secure and build on previous collaborations are embraced and best practices are followed.
	Organise and schedule capacity-building workshops and events that engage senior decision-makers across the public, private and multilateral sectors, and showcase our capabilities and expert network (e.g. PPP Masterclass).
	Contribute as required to the continuous review and update of our website, marketing and community engagement events and initiatives.
	Establish the office procedures, tools, templates, and bid-winning capabilities (incl. Expert database, contract, and contact management; EOI, RFQ, RFP templates; project management and governance processes).
	Support the preparation of proposals, EOIs, RFPs and other tender documents, including competitive challenges for Unsolicited Proposals.
	Contribute as required to the overall development of the company. Support the formulation of business strategies, risk management & controls through reviewing risk registers & mitigation strategies, and other related activities.


Team and Thought leadership:


	Provide leadership, direction, guidance and development support to senior associates and associate team members.
	Stay abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes, and market dynamics affecting PPP and infrastructure financing in Africa.
	Conduct studies related to projects and special topics relevant to the industry.
	Line management responsibility for in-house analysts and primary liaison with associates and technical experts (expert network).
	Produce blogs, insight reports and other publications that showcase the expertise of the team.
	Ensure high-quality standards across all team outputs in the project portfolio.
	Mobilise expert resources from personal networks and our expert database to support the delivery of internal and external projects.
	Lead and provide technical support to assigned projects and business development initiatives.
	As a senior member of our team, model our values in every engagement with the team, existing and potential clients, and the public.
	Maintain a problem-solving disposition and results mindset in all your dealings internally and externally.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree Qualifications in Economics, Engineering, Accounting, Business Administration, Finance or related fields (Required); Master's Degree or higher in any of the above considered an added advantage.
	Minimum of 5 - 7 years of relevant professional work experience in supporting the development and delivery of infrastructure at a reputable institution, preferably infrastructure consulting/advisory.
	5 – 7+ years in the professional services industry; experience in sales, bid and proposal development an added advantage.
	Strong ability to build and grow an opportunity pipeline.
	Proven ability to establish and build client relationships and engage and grow a network of stakeholders.
	Strong proficiency in the use of relevant document processing software for documents, presentations, marketing, research and analysis (MS Office applications – Outlook, Word, Excel & PowerPoint). Experience of web-design, digital or other social media skills; an advantage.
	Strong business acumen with excellent sales and negotiation skills.
	Strong project and people management experience. Professional certifications an advantage.
	Proven written and presentation skills in a range of formats (briefings, reports, summaries, etc.) and to a range of audiences.
	Sound knowledge of the infrastructure PPP space in Nigeria.


In addition, you will be able to demonstrate the following:


	Possess the ability to handle highly sensitive and confidential information while exercising professionalism and discretion.
	The right approach and experience to really support our ambition of being a world-class professional services firm.
	Enthusiastic and able to work in a fast-paced environment dealing with complex matters.
	Strong time-management skills and an ability to organize and coordinate multiple concurrent projects.
	Reliable, positive, solution-oriented, flexible approach to working.
	Outstanding interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills.
	A personable team player who is also able to work independently and on their own initiative.
	High attention to detail and the ability to prioritise tasks.
	Self-starter who drives individual projects and takes ownership of outcomes.
	Willing to travel locally and internationally.


Salary
N400,000 - N500,000 / month

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their copy of their CV and a brief covering email explaining how they meet the criteria above and what they might be able to bring to the role to: resourcing@ap3advisory.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: We will recruit on an ongoing basis so early applications are advised.

 

 

2.) Project and Research Analyst

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	This is a unique and exciting opportunity for a globally-minded individual with entrepreneurial, leadership, and problem-solving skills who is committed to developing a senior-level career in the professional services industry to join our Project Management Unit.
	Our Project Management team adds value by helping clients to create concept notes to conceptualise their desired projects and offering project delivery management and support services to. We take a client-centred approach to delivering professional services to public and private sector clients and development finance institutions.
	The ideal candidate will be proactive, detail-oriented, and possess exceptional written and verbal communication skills. S/he will have a growth mindset that will enable him or her to contribute to the development of the firm’s market positioning as trusted transaction advisors to public and private sector clients.
	The successful candidate will work closely with the Managing Partner, Associate Partners, and subject matter experts as part of the core programme management team leading our practice in the delivery of high-quality services to top-tier public, private and development partner clients.
	S/he will be responsible for assisting with the delivery of major capital and infrastructure projects across the full project life cycle in a wide range of sectors, including agriculture, transport, energy, real estate and social infrastructure. This position has the potential to grow into a senior management role within the Project Management / Transactions team or any of our portfolio management companies.


Key Responsibilities


	You will assist the leadership team in day-to-day delivery and engagement management on specific projects, with key responsibilities as follows: Project and Research Analyst
	Conduct data-driven research and analysis to develop insightful content for blog posts, insight reports, and policy papers.
	Conduct market and desktop research to identify emerging infrastructure and PPP opportunities in Africa and beyond, aligned with AP3 services and strategic priorities.
	Conduct market research and competitor analysis to identify emerging trends and potential business opportunities within our target sector.
	Collaborate with team members from various departments (e.g., project management, finance) to develop and refine compelling and compliant business proposals.
	Conduct primary and secondary research using various sources, such as surveys, interviews, and literature reviews in support of project delivery.
	Contribute to proposal writing, editing, proofreading, and formatting to ensure clarity, conciseness, and persuasiveness, and adherence to client and industry requirements.
	Develop detailed work plans and timelines for the delivery of assignments.
	Assist with project management tasks as needed, such as data analysis, report preparation, and stakeholders’ communication and management.
	Conduct research and gather relevant information to support the proposal content, including technical specifications, competitor analysis, and financial projections.
	Verify data, information, key stakeholders and analyse it to suit and support the work of project and transaction teams.
	Track, forecast and report on project progress, including metrics and challenges.
	Contributing as required to the preparation of tender documents, coordination of the bid evaluation processes, and capturing lessons learned and ensuring the effectiveness of clients’ capacity building processes and approach.
	Supporting the PMU/Transactions team with any additional work required. Business Development
	Assess, originate, and resource opportunities that fit with the company’s existing and emerging capabilities, drawing on the competencies of its expert network.
	Build and maintain relationships with existing and potential clients, associates and partner organisations, financial institutions, multilateral partners, and government officials.
	Assist with organizing and scheduling capacity-building workshops and events that engage senior decision-makers across the public, private and multilateral sectors, and showcase our capabilities and expert network (e.g. PPP Masterclass).
	Assist with establishing office procedures, tools, templates, and bid-winning capabilities (incl. Expert database, contract, and contact management; EOI, RFQ, RFP templates; project management and governance processes). • Assist in the preparation of proposals, EOIs, RFPs and other tender documents, including competitive challenges for Unsolicited Proposals.
	Contribute as required to the overall development of the company. Support the formulation of business strategies, risk management & controls through reviewing risk registers & mitigation strategies, and other related activities. Thought leadership
	Stay abreast of industry trends, regulatory changes, and market dynamics affecting PPP and infrastructure financing in Africa.
	Conduct studies related to projects and special topics relevant to the industry. • Produce blogs, insight reports and other publications that showcase the expertise of the team.
	Mobilize expert resources from personal networks and our expert database to support the delivery of internal and external projects.
	Provide technical support to assigned projects and business development initiatives.
	Model our values in every engagement with the team, existing and potential clients, and the general public.
	Maintain a problem-solving disposition and results mindset in all your dealings internally and externally.


Skills, Qualifications & Competencies


	Minimum of Degree in Economics, Business Administration, Finance, Public Policy, Environmental Science, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in project management, research, and analysis, with a focus on infrastructure or climate finance.
	A Master's Degree in any of the above will be an added advantage.
	Demonstrated experience in conducting feasibility studies, market research, and financial analysis.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent writing and communication skills.
	Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
	Experience in Africa, particularly West Africa, is a plus.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and project management tools.
	Experience drafting business plans and feasibility studies.
	Good interpersonal skills.
	Highly numerate, with exceptional oral and written communication skills, with demonstrable quantitative and qualitative data analysis skills, and proficiency in the use of Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Internet tools.
	Excellent writing, presentation and analytics skills in a range of formats (briefings, reports, summaries, etc.) and to a range of audiences.
	Proven capabilities to work effectively and constructively with diverse, inter-cultural, interdisciplinary and high-impact teams across multiple locations and time zones.
	Strong technical, analytical, and problem-solving capabilities.
	The right approach and experience to manage client relationships and really support our ambition of being a world-class professional services firm.
	Self-starter who drives individual projects and takes ownership of outcomes.
	Willing to travel locally and internationally.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / Month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of your CV and a brief Covering email explaining how you meet the criteria above and what you might be able to bring to the role. to: resourcing@ap3advisory.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: We will recruit on an ongoing basis so early applications are advised.

title: Job Vacancies at JMG Limited
content:
JMG Limited is a diversified solution provider with a broad portfolio in power generation, electrical infrastructures, and industrial equipment. With over 10 years of experience in Africa and strong partnerships with some of the world’s leading brands (CATERPILLAR INC, MITSUBISHI HEAVY INDUSTRIES, LEGRAND, GE LIGHTING, KAESER COMPRESSORS, THYSSENKRUPP), JMG combines global technologies and regional expertise to fulfill the development needs of the African market.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Pre-Trip Inspection Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Brief Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Pre-Trip Inspection Officer will ensure all fleet vehicles meet safety and operational standards before and after each trip through thorough inspections, defect reporting, and proper documentation.
	This role helps prevent breakdowns, improves compliance, and allows mechanics to focus on critical repairs.


Duties


	Conduct mandatory pre-trip and post-trip inspections (DVIRs) on all designated trucks and trailers.
	Check and verify:
	
		Lights and indicators
		Oil and fluid levels (engine oil, coolant, brake fluid)
		Air leaks / hydraulic leaks
		Tyre condition and pressure
		Brakes and brake lines
		Mirrors, horn, wipers
		Body condition, undercarriage, and suspension
		Safety equipment (extinguisher, triangle, jack, wheel spanner)
	
	
	Identify minor defects and immediately report them to maintenance (lights, loose connections, leaks, worn components, missing items).
	Escalate major safety issues such as brake faults, tyre failures, steering issues, or fluid leaks.
	Complete DVIR forms accurately and submit daily.
	Maintain a daily record of all inspections.
	Ensure drivers sign off before departure and after arrival.
	Support compliance with company policies, HSE standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Stop unfit vehicles from going on dispatch until repaired.
	Coordinate with mechanics and tyre officers for follow-up actions.
	Assist in monitoring preventive maintenance schedules.
	Take up IMS responsibilities such as reporting unsafe act, condition or procedure in the work place, participating in fire or emergency drill at work, participating in incident reporting and investigation when necessary and adherence to Company policies.


Minimum Requirements


	SSCE / Technical certification.
	1–5 years of experience in fleet inspection, transport operations, or mechanical support.
	Experience with heavy-duty trucks and trailers preferred.
	Basic mechanical knowledge is an added advantage.


Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of truck/trailer inspection procedures.
	Ability to identify defects quickly and accurately.
	Good communication skills (for interacting with drivers, mechanics, and supervisors).
	High attention to detail.
	Understanding safety standards and DVIR documentation.
	Strong administrative and documentation skills.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: F.esawe@jmglimited.com using the Job Position as the subject to the mail.

 

2.) Tyre Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Brief Description


	Tyre Officer will ensure effective management, maintenance, and monitoring of all tyres across the fleet to reduce breakdowns, minimize operating costs, improve tyre lifespan, and support safe, reliable transport operations.


Duties


	Maintain an accurate inventory of all tyres, tubes, rims, and related materials.
	Track tyre issuance, returns, and replacements in the tyre register or digital system.
	Identify minor defects and immediately report them to maintenance (lights, loose connections, leaks, worn components, missing items).
	Ensure proper storage and rotation of tyres to prevent deterioration.
	Conduct tyre changes, repairs, patching, and rotations on trucks, trailers, pickups, and other fleet units.
	Ensure correct torqueing and alignment practices during installation.
	Inspect tyres for wear, cracks, cuts, uneven patterns, and internal defects.
	Recommend tyres for replacement based on condition and safety standards.
	Perform regular tyre pressure checks according to manufacturer and company standards.
	Identify pressure deviations and immediately rectify them to prevent blowouts or premature wear.
	Carry out pre-trip and post-trip tyre inspections for all outbound trucks.
	Record tyre usage, mileage, CPK (Cost Per Kilometer), and performance for analysis.
	Assist in evaluating tyre brands, suppliers, and quality for procurement decisions.
	Prepare daily/weekly reports on tyre consumption, repairs, scrap analysis, and abnormalities.
	Provide technical support during breakdowns related to tyres on site or en-route.
	Ensure adherence to safety procedures during tyre handling, lifting, and repairs.
	Support the workshop team with wheel alignment and balancing requirements (if equipment is available).
	Take up IMS responsibilities such as reporting unsafe act, condition or procedure in the work place, participating in fire or emergency drill at work, participating in incident reporting and investigation when necessary and adherence to Company policies


Minimum Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE / Technical Certification.
	2 – 5 years of experience in tyre maintenance for heavy-duty trucks and trailers.
	Knowledge of tyre brands, load ratings, and repair procedures.
	Experience in commercial transport, logistics, or haulage industry preferred.


Competencies:


	Strong knowledge of truck and trailer tyre maintenance.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to diagnose tyre defects and recommend corrective actions.
	Good understanding of tyre pressure standards and safety protocols.
	Strong record-keeping and reporting skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and respond quickly to breakdowns.
	Attention to detail to prevent avoidable tyre-related failures.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: F.esawe@jmglimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Administrative Logistic Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Brief Description


	Logistics Admin Officer will support the Transport Division with accurate journey data entry, system mapping, tracking updates, document renewals, and contract management.
	The role ensures that all trips, costs, and compliance records are properly captured to enable operational planning, analysis, and performance reporting.


Duties


	Manage all data entries, trip creation, approvals, and mapping of workflows inside the Journey Management App.
	Update routes, KM benchmarks, trip types, delivery points, and return-to-base sequences.
	Ensure all client pricing, rates, and contract terms are correctly uploaded into the system.
	Maintain accurate trip logs for all departments and ensure full compliance with JMG journey policies.
	Capture and update KM per route, delivery zones, and expected mileage standards.
	Record and validate diesel consumption, fueling entries, and reconcile with expected KM.
	Upload and track journey expenses, such as:
	
		Tollgate fees
		Police/escort receipts
		Driver allowances
		Workshop emergency expenses
	
	
	Support the Transport Analyst in generating Cost-Per-Kilometre (CPK) and route expense analysis.
	Maintain accurate records of vehicle status, drivers, geo-fences, and alert settings.
	Support the Transport Analyst in generating Cost-Per-Kilometre (CPK) and route expense analysis.
	Monitor exceptions such as:
	
		Deviations
		Night movement
		Over-speeding
		Unauthorized stops
		Log incidents and escalate critical alerts to the Transport Analyst and Operations Team
	
	
	Follow up and renew all fleet documents:
	
		Vehicle license, Roadworthiness
		Insurance (Comprehensive / TPL)
		Permits & regulatory papers,
		Driver’s license
	
	
	Maintain a renewal calendar with reminders and ensure 100% compliance.
	Process accident, damage, and third-party insurance claims.
	Coordinate with insurance companies, workshops, and internal teams until resolution
	Maintain a detailed database of all claims for reporting.
	Keep updated records of all drivers, vehicles, trips, and renewals.
	Support internal and external audits through proper documentation.
	Assist in preparing weekly or monthly reports including:
	
		Vehicle license, Roadworthiness
		Insurance (Comprehensive / TPL)
		Permits & regulatory papers,
		Driver’s license
	
	
	Take up IMS responsibilities such as reporting unsafe act, condition or procedure in the work place, participating in fire or emergency drill at work, participating in incident reporting and investigation when necessary and adherence to Company policies


Minimum Requirements


	OND / HND qualifications / B.Sc Degree in Logistics, Transport, Business Admin, or related field.
	1 – 3 years of experience in transport administration, tracking, or fleet support.
	Experience with fleet software or journey management apps is an advantage.


Competencies:


	Strong administrative and documentation skills.
	Good understanding of mileage, fuel standards, and transport workflows.
	Ability to use journey management platforms, tracking systems, and Excel.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Strong follow-up and coordination skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: F.esawe@jmglimited.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
